hook.text: What is consciousness made of? Titchener wanted to break it into parts, like a chemist breaks down compounds.

buildup.text: Edward Titchener, Wundt's student, founded structuralism â€” the attempt to identify the basic elements of thought.

discovery.text: Using trained introspection, he cataloged sensations, images, and feelings as the building blocks of experience.

twist.text: Structuralism faded because introspection was unreliable. Two observers often gave different reports to one stimulus.

climax.text: Structuralism failed as a science but succeeded as an ambition: it asked what the mind is made of.

punchline.text: The first big idea in psychology was wrong â€” but it asked the right question.

quiz.question: What was the goal of structuralism?
options: To identify the basic elements of conscious experience
To study animal behavior in labs
To treat mental illness through therapy
